area_name: Comanche Ridge (NW Ridge of Comanche Point)

content.description: Begins at the base of the Redwall on the SW ridge, climbs through the Supai, traverses left at the base of the Coc and joins the "Agave Variation" to the NW (Comanche) ridge.

pathTokens: Comanche Ridge (NW Ridge of Comanche Point)

content.description:
This is the real deal.  Not just a few pitches through the Coconino to a Temple or Butte's summit, but an intimate encounter with the spectrum of strata available to you in the Canyon.  At times, sphincter strengthening. 

  This route climbs from the top of the Temple Butte formation (of the NW ridge), out. 

  First ascent, in two+ days, by John Harlin III, Anne Arrans, Roger Payne, and Nikolay Petkov (5.10).  See 2003 AAJ, pp. 201-02. 

  Second ascent, in 24 hrs. car to car with an enjoyable variation (Agave Variation 5.11-) through the Coc and Kaibab, by A. Frost and C. Kirk. 

  This route offers a preview of what new routing in the Ditch could become.

Comanche Ridge, from Dox Hill.  Photo by C. Kirk
